Name: Amulet Depicting Feathers of Amun
Description: The amulet depicts the two ostrich feathers that were part of the crown of the god Amun, called "Shuty" in the Egyptian language. The feathers were considered to be a power amulet. Although this type of amulet is made from inanimate objects, it was considered to be imbued with authority and power. The difference between these ostrich plumes and the falcon feathers, which were also used as amulets, is that the ostrich feathers are depicted with curled over tips and the falcon feathers have rounded tips.
